alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 27 at 9:35AM PST until December 28 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow diminishing this evening. Additional snow accumulations up to 6 inches for communities around Lake Tahoe, and up to 12 inches for areas above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 80 mph over Sierra ridges and up to 40 mph in the lower elevations. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Until 1 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel is nearly impossible today with many roads closed. Strong winds will cause whiteout conditions, large snow drifts, tree damage, and power outages.
info.instruction: Stay home and avoid travel, you will be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
